Stamford's Public Education Foundation encourages all SPS families to complete their 2020 Census Form. According to SPEF "The 2010 Census missed more than 10 percent of all children under age 5 in the U.S! As an example of how impactful this can be; if a 2 year old is missed, they won’t be counted (and federal dollars won’t be allocated annually for them) until they are in middle school.

In 2010, Stamford was severely undercounted and we can’t let that happen again! Data from the census determines funding which affects families in the areas of special education, Head Start, after-school programs, and classroom technology. Data also determines funding for food assistance, including free and reduced-price school lunches (through SNAP and WIC), and children’s health insurance programs (HUSKY) as well as Medicaid."

So, check your mailbox and GET COUNTED!
